name: Xournal Notebook
summary: Learn about .XOJ files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Xournal is a notetaking application, available for Linux and Windows, that simulates a real-life notebook. Xournal users can take notes, doodle, insert images, and even highlight and annotate their text, just as they would when using a real notebook.

Each Xournal notebook (which may consist of any number of pages) is saved within a XOJ file. If Xournal users want to share their notebook(s) with another Xournal user, they can do so by giving that user their XOJ file(s).
NOTE: XOJ files can also be opened in Xournal++, a cross-platform variant of Xournal.

description: An XOJ file is a notebook file that contains notes taken using the hand note-taking software Xournal. Xournal is a free, multi-platform application that lets you create notes with different content types such as text, images, and hand-written doodles. XOJ files are created when a new notebook file is created with Xournal. These XOJ files can be shared with other users as well for data sharing. A more recent version of Xournal is Xournal++ that is cross-platform variant of Xournal.

A XOJ file is a notebook created in Xournal, a free, multi-platform notetaking application. It contains the pages of a Xournal notebook. XOJ files may include text, images, highlighting, and other annotations.

instructions: You can open a XOJ file in either Xournal (Linux, Windows) or Xournal++ (cross-platform), both of which are available as free downloads. In either program, select File â†’ Open from the program's menu bar to open your XOJ file.
